paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Ser52Pro, including penetrance data and individual case details.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with cardiac amyloidosis at age 52.
Patient P2 presented with neuropathy symptoms at age 58.
Patient P3 remains asymptomatic despite carrying the variant.
Patient P4 was diagnosed with mixed amyloidosis at age 64.

functional_data.summary: The Ser52Pro variant shows increased fibrillogenic potential compared to wild-type TTR.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in affected family members.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical and functional data.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the aggressive nature of the Ser52Pro variant.
key_quotes: The Ser52Pro variant is responsible for the most aggressive known clinical phenotype.
Genuine amyloid fibril formation in vitro is much more extensive than previously reported.

tables_processed.table_caption: Clinical characteristics of TTR variant carriers

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
